column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had over 10- 4 hour ketamine infusions for rsd/crps pain. Ketamine is the only drug that has helped decrease the pain, swelling and burning associated with the rsd. I had very little side effects and the results last about 4 to 6 months. Most insurance plans will not pay for the procedure and it is expensive, but worth every cent.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My son who has CP has to be completely out to do any dental work or to have any tests (CT scans etc.). Ketamine worked FANTASTIC! I wish we would've known about it many years ago!!! He was sleepy but didn't notice any problems.

column2: haunteddreams213, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had an Occipital Nerve Block and was given Ketamine in addition to my local anesthesia. That night I had nightmares, vivid hallucinations, headaches, and general distress.I called my nurse and he informed me that while this reaction is "rare", it does occur in certain types of people--people that are sensitive to medication.Always discuss this with your doctor pre-procedure. I was not given the information until afterward.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given Ketamine as a general during reconstructive surgery after skin cancer removal.  It put me out, but I had vivid, unpleasant hallucinations for about 3 hours and then had a difficult recovery for the next few days, just feeling out of it.I was told I had to be given a relatively large dose. I am about 210 lbs and in good weight training and cardio shape.I will ask not to be treated with Ketamine in the future.
